{"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4393,"attracts":[],"care_level":"High","common_name":"iris","description":"Iris 'Pixie' is a dwarf or miniature species of Iris. It is perfect for planting in rock gardens and it can handle clay soil with ease. It is one of the most popular, easy to grow and low-maintenance varieties, requiring only the occasional watering during dry spells; and it is highly tolerant to drought. Its small flowers can be white, light blue, or lavender and are very aromatic. It grows to a maximum height of 6 inches and it is a perennial, flowering from late May to late June. The foliage is attractive all year round with its sword-shaped leaves, making it a great border plant. It's perfect for growing in full sun and soil with good drainage. The individual flower heads are large, with three inner petals and three outer petals, known as 'falls'. This plant is easy to grow and requires minimal maintenance. Its foliage remains attractive and evergreen throughout the growing season. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4405,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"Siberian iris","description":"Siberian iris (Iris 'Rill') is an easy-to-grow perennial rhizomatous plant, native to Europe, Asia, and North America. Its lovely bright purple blooms atop strong, gracefully-curving stems are an elegant and low-maintenance addition to any garden. This variety tends to form large clumps with freely-branching stems, and sometimes reaches heights up to 4 feet. Prune lightly after flowering to remove spent flowers and encourage more blooms! Siberian iris is suitable for planting in USDA zones 3-9, and prefers a moist environment. A member of the iris family and part of the Iridaceae family, this species is a must-have for any flower garden.","family":"Iridaceae","flower_color":"Blue with pale blue and white styles","flowering_season":null,"fruit_color":[],"growth_rate":"Low","harvest_season":null,"leaf_color":["green"],"maintenance":"Low","origin":["Russia","Japan","China","Korea"],"other_name":[],"pest_susceptibility":[],"propagation":["Division","Cormlet Propagation","Seed Propagation","Cutting"],"pruning_month":["May","June","August","May"],"scientific_name":["Iris 'Rill'"],"soil":[],"watering_period":null}}

{"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4414,"attracts":["Butterflies"],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"Siberian iris","description":"The Siberian Iris, also known by its botanical name Iris 'Sparkle', is a beautiful, low-maintenance perennial plant native to Siberia. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4450,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"ixia","description":"Ixia maculata is a stunning flower species from the family of Iridaceae. It is also commonly referred to as African Corn Lily. It blooms in late spring and produces pink, white, and yellow flowers with dark markings on petals. This tender, tender perennial prefers sunny to lightly shaded areas and does best in part-shade. The foliage is linear in shape and generally remains evergreen in milder climates. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4432,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"bamboo iris","description":"Bamboo Iris (Iris wattii) is an elegant and colourful plant that adds beauty to any garden. {"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4593,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"red-hot poker","description":"Red-hot pokers, also known as Kniphofia 'Cobra', are a striking addition to any garden. They grow from a single, tough stem, bearing colorful, bell-shaped flowers in a variety of shades. These flowers alternate up the stem, and in mature plants the uppermost flowers tend to be the most vivid, giving the entire plant an unusual, flame-like effect. The flowers attract plenty of pollinators, and their ripening seed heads provide plenty of food for wildlife. Red-hot pokers are resilient, easy to care for, and last well into autumn.","family":"Asphodelaceae","flower_color":"Tangerine fading to cream","flowering_season":null,"fruit_color":[],"growth_rate":"High","harvest_season":null,"leaf_color":["green"],"maintenance":"Moderate","origin":["South Africa"],"other_name":[],"pest_susceptibility":[],"propagation":["Division","Root Cutting","Seed Propagation","Layering Propagation"],"pruning_month":["May","May","May"],"scientific_name":["Kniphofia 'Cobra'"],"soil":[],"watering_period":null}}

{"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4589,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"red-hot poker","description":"Red-hot poker (Kniphofia 'Border Ballet') is a perennial herbaceous plant with stunningly bright yellow, red, and orange flower spikes radiating from its peak. Native to the grasslands of South Africa, this species is drought and deer resistant, and easy to maintain. Its evergreen foliage only adds to the beauty of long lasting blooms, making it a great border accent or addition to formal gardens. It's happiest in a sunny location, and it will usually bloom in early summer. Red-hot poker is a great choice for a low-maintenance plant that adds a burst of colour to the landscape.","family":"Asphodelaceae","flower_color":"Orange, red, pink, yellow and creamy pastels","flowering_season":null,"fruit_color":[],"growth_rate":"Low","harvest_season":null,"leaf_color":[],"maintenance":"Moderate","origin":["South Africa"],"other_name":[],"pest_susceptibility":[],"propagation":["Division","Root Cutting","Seed Propagation","Layering Propagation"],"pruning_month":["March","April","May"],"scientific_name":["Kniphofia 'Border Ballet'"],"soil":[],"watering_period":null}}

Its foliage is an olive-green colour and it forms attractive clumps in the garden. Red-hot poker provides striking colour and attracts an array of birds with its nectar-producing flowers. It offers colorful and bright yellow flowers which appear in late summer and last until early fall. The stems are upright, and the flowers have an attractive shape with spiky petals and a tubular center. The foliage is sword-shaped and mid-green with a red tinge at the base. This plant does best in full to partial sun and should be planted in moist, well-drained soil. It is a great choice for adding a splash of color to a garden and its long-lasting blooms attract pollinators.","family":"Asphodelaceae","flower_color":"Mango-orange","flowering_season":null,"fruit_color":[],"growth_rate":"High","harvest_season":null,"leaf_color":[],"maintenance":"Moderate","origin":["South Africa"],"other_name":[],"pest_susceptibility":[],"propagation":["Division","Root Cutting","Seed Propagation","Layering Propagation"],"pruning_month":["March","April","May","May","December","January","February"],"scientific_name":["Kniphofia 'Mango Popsicle'"],"soil":[],"watering_period":null}}

{"type":"json_schema","json_schema":{"id":4602,"attracts":[],"care_level":"Medium","common_name":"red-hot poker","description":"The red-hot poker (Kniphofia 'Peachy Cheeks') is known for its long, upright flowering spikes, resembling blazing torches. The flowerhead is composed of many small, tubular flowers, clustered together in groupings of two-tone peach and orange hues. Blooming from mid summer to late autumn, its ideal warm climate location and low water needs make it a perfect choice for sunny gardens with average watering needs. It grows best when planted in well-drained soil with plenty of sunshine. Its drought tolerance is also an added bonus. There are many varieties of red-hot poker, each one boasting its own unique color and texture. The 'Peachy Cheeks' variety is certainly one of the most eye-catching.","family":"Asphodelaceae","flower_color":"Cream blushed with peach","flowering_season":null,"fruit_color":[],"growth_rate":"High","harvest_season":null,"leaf_color":["green","peach"],"maintenance":"Moderate","origin":["South Africa"],"other_name":[],"pest_susceptibility":[],"propagation":["Division","Root Cutting","Seed Propagation","Layering Propagation"],"pruning_month":["March","April"],"scientific_name":["Kniphofia 'Peachy Cheeks'"],"soil":[],"watering_period":"night"}}
